abstract: A projection of the observed object that provides bindings to its properties.
overview:
## Discussion

Use the projected value to get a binding to a value that the delegate publishes. Access the projected value by prefixing the name of the delegate instance with a dollar sign (`$`). For example, you might publish a Boolean value in your application delegate:

If you declare the delegate in your [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/App] using the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/NSApplicationDelegateAdaptor] property wrapper, you can get the delegate that SwiftUI instantiates from the environment and access a binding to its published values from any view in your app:
title: projectedValue
